title: PV Diagram - Q for thermodynamic cycle

content.question: An ideal gas is in a container with a moveable piston and goes through thermodynamic cycle <math alttext="X arrow Y, arrow Z, arrow X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>X</mtext></math>, as shown in the <math alttext="P V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>PV</mi></math> diagram. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the total energy <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> transferred to the gas by heating is zero or positive, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Zero, because the gas starts and ends at the same pressure and volume
Zero, because the total work done on the gas during the cycle is zero
Positive, because the total work done on the gas during the cycle is negative
Positive, because the internal energy of the gas is higher at the end of the cycle than at the beginning

content.answer: Positive, because the total work done on the gas during the cycle is negative

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
